riddle: I have Three eyes, all in a row; when the red one opens, all freeze like the snow.
What gets wetter and wetter the more it dries?
If you speak my name, you break me. What am I?
I have a tail, and I have a head, but I have no body. I am NOT a snake. What am I?
What word becomes shorter when you add letters to it?
What word begins with a T, ends with a T, and has a T in it?
What word begins with an E, ends with an E, but has only one letter?
The more there is, the less you see. What is it?
What building has the most stories in the world?
What can fill a room but doesn't take up space?
Where does Thursday come after Friday?
What word is spelled wrong in the dictionary?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
I’m tall when I’m young, and I’m short when I’m old. What am I?
What can you break, even if you never pick it up or touch it?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. What am I?
What can’t talk but will reply when spoken to?
What gets bigger when more is taken away?
What is black when it’s clean and white when it’s dirty?
What has many keys but can’t open a single lock?
If you’ve got me, you want to share me; if you share me, you haven’t kept me. What am I?
What goes up and down but doesn’t move?
What has hands, but can’t clap?
What has legs, but doesn’t walk?
